intro: Humboltia articulata, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a shrub native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features narrow, succulent leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in the summer months. Its stems are segmented and can be segmented, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Humboltia. The plant is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils.
